intro: Brachyotum tyrianthinum, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is characterized by its yellow-orange, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in moist, wooded areas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is relatively rare and requires specific environmental conditions to thrive.
